intro: Scyphostelma bifidum, commonly known as the bifid star moss, is a rare and delicate member of the family Pottiaceae. It is a small, cryptogamic plant that thrives in rocky, shaded environments, typically found in mountainous regions. The plant has a distinctive star-shaped morphology with two lobes, giving it its common name. Its leaves are thin and often covered in a layer of cuticle to retain moisture. Scyphostelma bifidum plays a minor but important role in soil stabilization and as a habitat for microorganisms in its native ecosystems.
